title: Huawei pips Xiaomi to China top spot
text:
Huawei pips Xiaomi to China top spot Article By: Hadlee Simons Fri, 23 Oct 2015 10:31 AM Share The Huawei P8. Credit: Hadlee Simons 
Huawei has overtaken Xiaomi to become the number one smartphone manufacturer in China. 
According to ZDNet and Sina , Huawei moved past Xiaomi in the third quarter of the year. 
Huawei saw year-on-year shipment growth of 81 percent, while Xiaomi's shipments fell during the same period. 
Sina reported that Huawei managed to sell 27 million devices in the quarter, compared to Xiaomi's 18.5 million units. 
The market changes come as Xiaomi also readies a new update for its devices. 
MIUI 7 is expected to roll out on October 27 for the MiPad, Mi4i, the Mi3, Redmi 2, Redmi Note Pro and Redmi 1S. 
Xiaomi says that the MIUI 7 update will improve battery life, introduce a theme builder and a kids mode. 
The news also comes as Huawei rolls out its new Mate S smartphone in South Africa. Related Articles
